text: Thanks <@ULCSUPTGU> I will check it out and let you know if I have questions. So much to figure out about this new Theme engine - but I love it!

Settings > Branding > Brand Kit

Can colors listed here be referenced in templates, or is this just for populating color pickers in the content editors? I want to replace some colors, but I don't want to break existing pages if it's possible to reference them using HuBL. *answered*
Answered! Realized this was more appropriate as a support question. For posterity: brand kit colors and theme colors are separate. Can't reference one from the other, according to support.

When I change an old page drag and drop page's template to a theme template and set a password to access it. It uses the old password prompt page and not the one in the theme. Is there a way to specify what template to use for the password prompt?
<@ULCSUPTGU> I did not find anything about "Template swap" - are you referring to using the staging area?
ok thank you Jon. So this will have to be done after launch then because this impacts the live site.

Hey Evan! Apologies for the misinformation from Support, but we recently just went GA with a feature that allows access using the `brand_settings` HubL token. Check out <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/branding-settings-inheritance> for more info on how to use it, and do you mind sending me either your Portal ID or your Support Ticket ID so I can follow up with Support and make sure they know about this new feature

Ah, cool. Well in *my* case, it's not a problem because if it's a new feature, I'm pretty sure nobody implemented anything using the brand_settings :slightly_smiling_face:

I'll F/U with my portal id and such. Thanks for the info Mitchell
